attributes.action: recognise that the rights to Cuban music belong to Cuban musicians
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Anywhere in the world, musicians expect to own the rights to their compositions. Not so in Cuba. American company Peer bullied, deceived and manipulated musicians into signing contracts, of at best dubious legality, both in the 1930s and 1990s. They are trying to avoid paying Cuban musicians the royalties due to them, on technicalities. This is morally wrong. Peer are simply greedy, and/ or do not want to pay money to Cubans. Yet another example of US aggression towards Cuba.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
